Story: I would like the ability to provision developer accounts.
I want to be able to allow delegation of administrative privileges to S/LEA admins

Short Name: Approval and provisioning access for applications
Story: I would like to provision access for applications so that they may access the appropriate environments and data in SLI
I want a Data Browser tool that will allow me to traverse all of the data I have access to so that I can investigate issues as they come up.
I want read access to a filterable, defined set of list views (queries) that are easy to iterate over via a REST API.

PO Owner: Any PO whose team has CRUDed an entity.
Story: I want CRUD access to the most frequently used core entities via a REST API
As an educator, I want to filter the students or groups on a list view, so that I can see more targeted information.
As an educator, I want to sort the order of a list view by any column, so that I can see area of strength or concern.
As an educator, I want to type in the name of student and get a list of matches.  Clicking an item in this list brings me to the profile page.
As an SLI dev, I want basic configuration tools to make and edit lists and profiles, so that educators can use them.
As a teacher, I want to see a grade-book like dashboard of students in my classes.  I want to see different columns of data too.
As a teacher or school leader, I want to see a list of classes, with aggregate student data (even if that data is not updated regularly, or is fake).
As a school leader, I want to see a list of grades, with aggregate student data (even if that data is not updated regularly, or is fake).
As a school leader or accountability office, I want to see a list of teachers in a school, with aggregate student data (even if that data is not updated regularly, or is fake).
As a S/LEA leader, I want to see a list of schools with aggregate student data, and school metadata (even if that data is not updated regularly, or is fake).

Short Name: PROTOTYPE -- General Navigation/UI (List of Schools Groups)
Story: As S/LEA leader or legislator, I want to see a list of schools in district, region, or other grouping with aggreagate student and school data (even if that data is not updated regularly, or is fake).
As an educator, I want to see all the data available about a particular student.
As a school or S/LEA leader, I want to see data about a staff member, including aggregate data about students they teach  (even if that data is not updated regularly, or is fake).
As a S/LEA leader, I want to see information about a school, including aggregate data about students in that school  (even if that data is not updated regularly, or is fake).

As a S/LEA leader, I want to see information about a district, region or other group of schools, including aggregate data about students in that school group  (even if that data is not updated regularly, or is fake).
I want the ability to create, store and retrieve custom data that is tied to a parent core entity.  This data will inherit permissions from the CORE parent.

I want to understand the data model by reading a document describing both the core and custom entity model.  I want to see this through documentation and examples to help me understand and leverage the SLI model for both data input and usage through custom built client software.
Wiki-based tech docs and run books for the platform
I want to understand the dev environment that the WGEN development team is using so I know what to procure.
I want to understand the SLI API to be able to develop my application.  (SDK documentation)
I should be able to schedule a recurring bulk upload of my data so that all of the applications our school district(s) is using are working with fresh data.
I would like open-source reference clients for usage of the bulk data ingestion APIs

Short Name: Integrity checking with actionable error reports
Story: When something goes wrong, I want to know about it by having robust integrity checking and conflict identification, complemented with actionable error reporting
As a user, I see a login screen that brings me to the SLI home page.
As any user I see a portal home page with a listing of applications available to me.
As a user logging in for the first time, I must click through a EULA acceptance.
I want to be able to see a common header & footer UI that conforms to SLI standards.
I want a common UI element to return to SLI home page that I may place in my app as I please

Short Name: Report a problem or give feedback
Story: As a user, I want to be able to report application and/or data problems so that they can be fixed and/or provide feedback on an application.
As an IT admin, I want SLI Portal to include existing applications/components that exist in my state/district.
As a user, I see a common legal notice about data privacy across apps.
I want the framework and documentation needed to write and execute unit tests locally, as well as have them run in a Continuous Integration environment.
I want the framework and documentation needed to write and execute Acceptance tests and have them run in a CI environment
I want the framework needed to write and execute performance and load tests, and include them in a CI environment for regression purposes.
I would like to automatically create a sandbox environment for developer accounts that provides only API and Auth access
I would like my sandbox environment to be resettable to factory defaults through an API call
Java "Hello World" app displaying a page of student data through API calls
I can configure an inactivity timeout up to an SLI-configurable max, and that timeout is enforced at the API layer.
I want code examples that show how to use our authorization system to enforce permissions in an application for the five different roles (public, student, parent, educator, administrator).
I want to be able to map SEA/LEA users and their roles to SLI roles.
As a state admin, I want to be able to onboard my district(s) by creating the appropriate super administrator accounts.
I want to be able to register my application with SLC and have it approved by an SLC operator.
As an SLC operator I need to be able to revoke application and/or developer access to SLI.
As an LEA, I want to be able to grant access to an SEA to particular entities and attributes.
I would like the ability to see all administrative/operator functions that are available to me.

Short Name: Approval and provisioning of dev accounts
Story: I would like to provision access for developers so that they may access the appropriate environments and data in SLI
Workflow for provisining (super)admin accounts

Short Name: Default role and permission configuration and enforcement
Story: Role and permission configuration and enforcement
I want to configure and enforce permissions for application accounts
I want to be able to store and retrieve the most common data as defined in the EdFi model.
I would like to automatically create a sandbox environment for developer accounts to include ingestion.
Configure and integrate SEA/LEA identities using SAML Identity Integration
Define a discrete set of default roles and provide the ability to enforce permissions.
As an educator, I want to see a dashboard that includes General Student Info for individual students.

PO Owner: Janko Bazhdavela, Steve Peha, Jeff Kidd
Story: As an educator, I want to see dashboards that include Displine and Attendance for individual students.
As an educator, I want to see dashboards that include Course Work and Graduation for individual students.
As an educator, I want to see dashboards that include Assesment Results for individual students.
I would like the ability to retrieve security events through the API

Short Name: Provision resources during onboarding of S/LEA
Story: When a new SEA/LEA is onboarded, automatically provision necessary resources for that SEA/LEA to begin using SLI
I would like to import the most common entities in Ed-Fi XML data
I would like to import CSV data in a format that is logically similar to Ed-Fi XML, for the portion of Ed-Fi that is in Alpha
I would like access to sample data for at least 2 states with single digit districts, double digit schools, thousands of teachers, and tens of thousands of students.

I would like access to sample data for at least 2 states with single digit districts, double digit schools, and hundreds of thousands of students with tens of assessment results per student and tens of thousands of teachers.

PO Owner: Any PO whose team has CRUDed an entity.
Story: I want CRUD access to all core data entities via a REST API.
I would like scripts that I can run to validate my Ed-Fi data extracts are correct prior to submission to SLI
As a user, I see a login screen that brings me to the SLI home page.
